The given Node.js code is a conditional module export that chooses between two different module files, `emotion-react.cjs.prod.js` and `emotion-react.cjs.dev.js`, based on the environment the code is running in. This is commonly done to load a production-optimized version of a library when the `NODE_ENV` environment variable is set to `"production"` and a development version otherwise. 

Here's a possible rewrite of this code:

```javascript
'use strict';

const env = process.env.NODE_ENV;
let modulePath;

// Determine the module path based on the environment
if (env === "production") {
  modulePath = "./emotion-react.cjs.prod.js";
} else {
  modulePath = "./emotion-react.cjs.dev.js";
}

// Export the appropriate module
module.exports = require(modulePath);
```
